question: What is the disadvantage of real addressing mode?
options: ['a) there is a lot of cost involved', 'b) time consumption overhead', 'c) absence of memory protection between processes', 'd) restricted access to memory locations by processes']
option1: a) there is a lot of cost involved
option3: c) absence of memory protection between processes
option4: d) restricted access to memory locations by processes

question: Preemptive, priority based scheduling guarantees ____________
options: ['a) hard real time functionality', 'b) soft real time functionality', 'c) protection of memory', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: Real time systems must have ____________
options: ['a) preemptive kernels', 'b) non preemptive kernels', 'c) preemptive kernels or non preemptive kernels', 'd) neither preemptive nor non preemptive kernels']
option3: c) preemptive kernels or non preemptive kernels
option4: d) neither preemptive nor non preemptive kernels

question: What is Event latency?
options: ['a) the amount of time an event takes to occur from when the system started', 'b) the amount of time from the event occurrence till the system stops', 'c) the amount of time from event occurrence till the event crashes', 'd) the amount of time that elapses from when an event occurs to when it is serviced.']
option1: a) the amount of time an event takes to occur from when the system started
option2: b) the amount of time from the event occurrence till the system stops
option3: c) the amount of time from event occurrence till the event crashes
option4: d) the amount of time that elapses from when an event occurs to when it is serviced.

question: Interrupt latency refers to the period of time ____________
options: ['a) from the occurrence of an event to the arrival of an interrupt', 'b) from the occurrence of an event to the servicing of an interrupt', 'c) from arrival of an interrupt to the start of the interrupt service routine', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option1: a) from the occurrence of an event to the arrival of an interrupt
option2: b) from the occurrence of an event to the servicing of an interrupt
option3: c) from arrival of an interrupt to the start of the interrupt service routine

question: Real time systems need to __________ the interrupt latency
options: ['a) minimize', 'b) maximize', 'c) not bother about', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: The amount of time required for the scheduling dispatcher to stop one process and start another is known as ______________
options: ['a) event latency', 'b) interrupt latency', 'c) dispatch latency', 'd) context switch']

question: The most effective technique to keep dispatch latency low is to ____________
options: ['a) provide non preemptive kernels', 'b) provide preemptive kernels', 'c) make it user programmed', 'd) run less number of processes at a time']
option4: d) run less number of processes at a time

question: Priority inversion is solved by use of _____________
options: ['a) priority inheritance protocol', 'b) two phase lock protocol', 'c) time protocol', 'd) all of the mentioned']
